If you had a piece of advice to the people along the Mississippi Gulf Coast or in New Orleans today, what would it be?
Just videotape everything, photograph everything, document it.
And if you're going to--if your house is only damaged and not gone completely, don't wait.
Get in there as soon as they allow you to.

Get that wet stuff out of there because people who waited on their insurance settlements to begin the process then had a much bigger thing--bigger project because the mold had begun to grow to the beams and now you needed mold treatments, etc. We were literally in there before we had electricity back on, I photographed--we were running off generators.
